title: Bug 4971: Strange 'copy package'
description: When performing the 'copy package' operation in the 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' plugin within the 'jdt.ui' plugin, the package 'ui' is erroneously present in the destination folder 'xx'. This behavior is unexpected.
OB: After copying the package, the folder 'xx' contains a package named 'ui'
EB: After copying the package, the folder 'xx' should not contain a package named 'ui'
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Open the 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' plugin within the 'jdt.ui' project. 2. Select the 'copy package' operation. 3. Choose 'xxx' as the destination folder. 4. Observe that the folder 'xx' contains a package named 'ui'.
